2.text: “If only my grief could be weighed and placed with my calamity on the scales.

3.text: For then it would outweigh the sand of the seas—no wonder my words have been rash.

4.text: For the arrows of the Almighty have pierced me; my spirit drinks in their poison; the terrors of God are arrayed against me.

5.text: Does a wild donkey bray over fresh grass, or an ox low over its fodder?

6.text: Is tasteless food eaten without salt, or is there flavor in the white of an egg?

7.text: My soul refuses to touch them; they are loathsome food to me.

8.text: If only my request were granted and God would fulfill my hope:

9.text: that God would be willing to crush me, to unleash His hand and cut me off!

10.text: It still brings me comfort, and joy through unrelenting pain, that I have not denied the words of the Holy One.

11.text: What strength do I have, that I should still hope? What is my future, that I should be patient?

12.text: Is my strength like that of stone, or my flesh made of bronze?

13.text: Is there any help within me now that success is driven from me?

14.text: A despairing man should have the kindness of his friend, even if he forsakes the fear of the Almighty.

15.text: But my brothers are as faithless as wadis, as seasonal streams that overflow,

16.text: darkened because of the ice and the inflow of melting snow,

17.text: but ceasing in the dry season and vanishing from their channels in the heat.

18.text: Caravans turn aside from their routes; they go into the wasteland and perish.

19.text: The caravans of Tema look for water; the travelers of Sheba hope to find it.

20.text: They are confounded because they had hoped; their arrival brings disappointment.

21.text: For now you are of no help; you see terror, and you are afraid.

22.text: Have I ever said, ‘Give me something; offer me a bribe from your wealth;

23.text: deliver me from the hand of the enemy; redeem me from the grasp of the ruthless’?

24.text: Teach me, and I will be silent. Help me understand how I have erred.

25.text: How painful are honest words! But what does your argument prove?

26.text: Do you intend to correct my words, and treat as wind my cry of despair?

27.text: You would even cast lots for an orphan and barter away your friend.

28.text: But now, please look at me. Would I lie to your face?

29.text: Reconsider; do not be unjust. Reconsider, for my righteousness is at stake.

30.text: Is there iniquity on my tongue? Can my mouth not discern malice?
